name: Parul Chaudhary
biography: Parul Chaudhary is an Indian long-distance runner known for her achievements in the 5000 meters and 3000 meters steeplechase. She gained prominence by winning a gold medal in the 5000m and a silver in the 3000m steeplechase at the 2022 Asian Games. Parul is the first Indian woman to clock a sub-nine minute time in the women's 3000m steeplechase.
childhood: Born into a farming family, Parul began her athletics journey at the age of 16 when her father encouraged her to participate in a school race. She initially ran barefoot and quickly transitioned from 800m to longer distances, eventually specializing in 5000m and steeplechase events.
professional_career: Parul's career highlights include winning a silver medal in the 5000m at the 2019 South Asian Games and a bronze at the Asian Athletics Championships. In 2023, she set a national record in the 3000m steeplechase with a time of 9:15.31 at the World Athletics Championships, securing her qualification for the 2024 Paris Olympics.
